question: [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewOrganization()] [Validation Timing] Line 280 calls Validate(organization) after creating organization object - if validation fails, can partially created organizations leak state? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewOrganization()] [Hash Collision] Lines 268-270 calculate organizationAddress from CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair() - can hash collisions allow organization address conflicts? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewOrganization()] [State Override] Lines 281-282 return early if organization exists - can this prevent organization updates or create stale organization data? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CreateNewOrganization()] [Event Consistency] Lines 285-288 fire OrganizationCreated event even if organization already exists (after line 282 return) - wait, no it doesn't, the return happens first. Can the early return cause event/state inconsistencies? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Hash Collision] Line 296 uses HashHelper.ComputeFrom(createOrganizationInput) - can two different organization inputs produce same hash, causing address collision? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Virtual Address] Lines 297-299 use ConvertVirtualAddressToContractAddressWithContractHashName() with virtual hash - can this conversion be exploited to generate predictable or malicious addresses? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateOrganizationHashAddressPair()] [Token Dependency] Line 299 calls CalculateVirtualHash(organizationHash, createOrganizationInput.CreationToken) - can CreationToken manipulation cause address prediction attacks? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateVirtualHash()] [Null Token] Lines 309-311 return organizationHash if creationToken is null, otherwise concat and compute - can null vs non-null token create two organizations with same params but different addresses? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/Parliament_Helper.cs] [Function: CalculateVirtualHash()] [Hash Collision] Line 311 uses HashHelper.ConcatAndCompute() - can hash collision allow different (organizationHash, creationToken) pairs to produce same virtual hash? (Medium)
